description: a(n) = n!/(k!)^2, where k is the largest number such that (k!)^2 divides n!.
comments: Least integer of the form n!/{(n-k)!}^2.Similar to but different from A001405.
links: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: E.g. for n=9, 10, 11, 12, a(n)=630, 7, 77, 924 while the corresponding central binomial coefficients are 126, 252, 462, 924 respectively.
mathematica: f[n_] := Min[ Select[ Table[ n!/(n - k)!^2, {k, n}], IntegerQ[ # ] &]]; Table[ f[n], {n, 33}] (_Robert G. Wilson v_)
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 25 2000
